text: Bottled on 28/06/2014. Kirkkaan lagerimainen väri, olematon vaahto. Tuoksu mietoa ipamaisuutta kissankusen kera, bonuksena väkevyyttä, luumuviinaakin lämmettyään. Suutuntuma vahva mutta mieto, ristiriitainen yhdistelmä. Jälkifiiliksenä vahva alapäinen alkoholinen överiannostus ilman kompensoivaa yläkitalaen fiilistä, lämmintä marjaa löytyy myös lämpöisenä. Lämpöisenä lasin pohjia juodessa aika kiva, ensin alkuun en lämmennyt.

750ml bottle. A gift from Hives. Hazy orange. Film and a few bubbles of white. Nose is peachy sweet. Yeasty, bready malts. Soft toffee. A bit of booze. Taste is robust, chewy sweet, with some hefty bitterness. Rich and full bodied. Finishes with a vanilla sweetness, and a bosh of boozy rich bitterness. Definitely a grower. I warmed to it, and it warmed me!

Flaske (thanks, Steven!), delt med Ovesen på Holmens aktivitetsdag: opp fra et flott skum(som varer helt til siste slurk) stiger en velduft av mango, appelsin, fersken, tørkede frukter sammen med en knivsodd pepper. Og smaken er bare helt yummy, balansert og elegant. Varmer i magen, dette er lekre saker! På etiketten står det Imperial pale stout. Burde det heller stått Stout imperial pale ale?

Bottle shared with JMD at HNB 29.08.15. Hazy, dark golden. Foamy and persistent white head and lacing. Aroma of honey, dried fruits, papaya, bitter marmelade pepper and coriander. Similar, and complex, taste. Quite bitter. Could probably have been stored and matured for years. Too late...

Bottle @ Clerko. Cheers, Kenny! Gold pour with a white head. Nose is surprisingly mild mannered. Buttery chess cookies, short bread. Clotted cream. Taste is fully of creamy, nutty malts. A bit of honeyed apples. Growing heat on the finish. Rich. Decent.

Bottle from Whistle Stop Wines in Saltburn. Pours golden with a white head. Mild citrus aroma. The taste is lots of citrus and spice. Along with pretty evident alcohol. Feels too boozy really with not enough flavour to go along with it. Pleasant, but I was hoping for a lot more as Im usually a fan of Durham beers.

Clear, golden colour with quite nice white head. Sweet, malty, fruity (berries) aroma with some hoppy, herbal note and hint of alcohol on finish. Sweet taste, some sourness, spices and too strong alcohol.

Swing-Top bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Golden coloured with a citrus, pine and peppery hop flavour, pineapple and earthy citrus notes followed by a smooth, creamy warming alcoholic and fruity pear finish. Excellent!!

29th December 2014Bottle share warm up at Craft Clerkenwell. Hazy amber beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light and dry. Modest fine carbonation. Light dry pale malts. Spice, white pepper mostly. Little pithy grapefruit bitterness. Light floral bitterness then more spice. Mild orange and grapefruit before a spicy semi dry finish. First few mouthfuls I really wasnt digging this but it slowly won me over and I enjoyed the rest of my glass if not bowled over.

Bottle. Golden body with fast disappearing white head. Aroma is some almonds some ripe fruits and hints of alcohol. Taste is ripe fruits some malts some hints of pepper. Aftertaste is medium bitter with some malty sweetness. I think this would be aging well.

Bottle at the 5/7.5/10 K tasting, 30/12/14.
Hazed orange amber with little in the way of a head.
Nose is bitter citric rinds, sweet notes, orange peel, spice, candy bar, light booze.
Taste comprises candied fruit peel, white chocolate, citric rinds.
Medium + body, fine carnonation, sweet licks in the close, a little cloying.
Noot my kinda beer - !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Big 7fiddy bottle, thanks to Kenny. It pours lightly hazy golden-amber with a small white head. The nose is toasty, honey, caramel, crunchy nut cornflakes, earth and toast. The taste is bitter, boozy, toasted grain, butterscotch, spice, straw, wood, vanilla, burnt grass and bread with a dry, warming finish. Medium-full body and moderate carboantion. Oil mouth-feel. A bit hot and harsh. OK at best.

Bottle shared, hazy gold with a lasting white head, lovely spicy nose with a strong alcohol overlay, rich and dry-sweet, faintly yeasty with hints of golden fruit, dry and warming with notes of marmalade and bread.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2014 Bottle shared at CBC Clerkenwell - thanks to Kenny. Pours hazy gold with a foamy white head. Interesting nose, some marmalade and dried citrus, flowers. Medium sweet flavor, fairly bitter. Some toasted leaves, rindy citrus, dry white bread. Medium to full bodied with average carbonation. Moderate sweetness on the finish, some hay, more dried citrus, sun-baked bread. Novel. Fair.
500ml bottle from the brewery, shared with Ashton McCobb. Pours clear golden orange, thin white head. Aromas of cooked oranges, caramel. Taste is boozy, more orange, gnarly, fresh maybe? Not bad.

Bottle from the brewery.
Appearance - 
Nose - oranges, maybe even burnt oranges. Malty backdrop.
Taste - burnt oranges mangled with dry malt.
Palate - medium to full bodied with a big tangy texture and a long dry finish.
Overall - this is a barley wine, in my opinion. Again, slightly gnarly in character!

Sampled from a 50cl bottle with a crown cork, not a swing-top as in the photo shown here. Amber-gold colour with a foaming white head. The taste is rich and malty with plenty of alcohol. There is a complex, dark Seville orange marmalade taste with hints of honey, plum pudding and pine resin. Long honeyed finish. A rich and complex ale.

Bottle 750ml. w. swing top @ [ Pre-Borefts Ratebeer Gathering ] @ ABCBeers, Korte Koediefstraat 5, The Hague, Netherlands 2511CE. [ As Durham 1994 ].Clear medium yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted - caramel, pale malt. Flavour is moderate sweet with a average to long duration, fruity, sharp, pale malt, well hidden alcohol. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20140925]

500ml bottle from the Cheese & Wine Shop, Darlington. Clear deep orangey amber colour, foamy white head leaving lacing and aroma of fruity hop, resiny and some spice. Taste is sweetish malty, caramel, toffee with fruity notes, some orange rind citrus, hoppy, pine, and lots of grassy bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry warm grassy boozy finish. Very drinkable.

Bottle at pre-borefts tasting .
Pours unclear yellow , small white head . 
Smell is a bit sweet . 
Taste is sweet . Sugar , some honey-barley character . No idea how this is a stout ( label reads blonde imperial stout ) . Drinkable , but nothing to go crazy over at all

Bottle shared at the Pre-Borefts Tasting. Pours hazy golden with an off white head. Aroma of grass, herbs, yeast, citrus, caramel, malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
Bottle. Hazy golden. Some fruitiness, yeast, funk, barnyard and citrus. Medium sweet. Medium bitter. Medium bodied.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a clear light amber with a thin broken white head. The aroma is light sweet malt, light nettle hop. The flavour is strong bitter with a rich aniseed alcoholic bitter palate. Medium bodied with average carbonation.

bottle @ Pre Borefts tasting.
Thin white head. hazy blond pour. Nice bitterness. Well hidden alcohol. Nice
Poured a hazy light amber with a small off white ring. Aroma of sweet citrus and caramel malt. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, lightly bitter with a lingering spicy end.
Bottle midlands tasting group. Golden thin head. Aroma is sweet caramel fruits alcohol taste is same nice sweetness and bitter finish. Medium body. Good stuff

Bottle. ( Swing Top 750 CL ) Golden appearance. Sweet and smooth with a trace of honey. Quite powerful but easy to drink. Its some time since I tried one from this brewery but this was certainly impressive even if it had to be treated with respect.

Bottle @ Midlands Tasting Aug 14, at Richies Hop Palace. Pours gold with very slight haze. Liqueur aroma, English old ale crossed with a silky barley wine with a hint of onions and off flavours on the finish. Nice though.

Shared 750ml bottle at the Midland meet on 23rd Aug 2014. Poured a golden colour with a weak, thin white head. The aroma and taste reminded me of a sweet Lemon Meringue Pie sort of affair with plenty of alcohol thrown in for good measure. I took to it straight away.

Copper beer with small head. Aroma of caramel and malts. Taste is caramel, sweet malts and some alcohol. Palate is light to medium with a little oil. Decent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: 750ml bottle. Pours deep gold with a small head. Aroma is sweet icing sugar, lemon and orange. Taste is sweet straw. Touch of alcohol. Sticky mouthfeel.

Bottle at Midlands Tasting Group via Cotteridge Wines; clear golden yellow pour with a thin white head, boozy aroma with lemon a caramel, taste has caramel, but and some lemon, big ABV present, bitter finish.
